intro: Ritchiea capparoides, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Moraceae, which includes figs and mulberries. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Ritchiea capparoides produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, fleshy fruits that are highly valued in local cuisine. This species is often found growing in rocky or disturbed soils, demonstrating its adaptability to challenging environments.
